30621BOSAA-d-06-21-93-ATK.Narrative: PROVEDENCE AND WORCESTER FREIGHT NR2 HAD PERFORMED VARIOUS SWITCHING MOVES IN THE OLD SAYBROOK AREAON JUNE 21, 1993. AFTER PUTTING THE TRAIN TOGETHER IT CONSISTED OF TWO LOCOMOTIVES, 11 LOADS, AND 36EMPTIES. AFTER SWITCHES WERE LINED FROM YARD TRACK 7 TO MAIN LINE TRACK 2 THE ENGINEER PROCEEDED TOMOVE HIS TRAIN IN AN EAST DIRECTION. WHILE PROCEEDING AT APPROXIMATELY 5 MPH THE ENGINEER FELT A TUG ON HIS TRAIN AND NOTICED DUST AROUND THE MIDDLE OF HIS CONSIST. AFTER MAKING A SAFE STOPIT WAS FOUND THAT THE 24TH THROUGH 27TH CARS HAD DERAILED AT THE SWTICH LEADING FROM YARD TRACK 7 TO YARD TRACK 3. THE 24TH, 25TH, AND 26TH CARS WERE LOADED WITH SCRAP WIRE THE 27TH CAR WAS EMPTY. THE DERAILMENT COMMITTEE FOUND THE CAUSE TO BE A SWITCH POINT THAT BROKE UNDER NORMAL MOVEMENT AND HAD WEDGED BETWEEN THE POINT AND STOCK RAIL.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
